items.sentence: Which is the capital of the United States, Washington or New York?
I have some questions to ask, but I don\'t want to bother you now.
I thought Tom was supposed to be in Boston. What\'s he doing here?
Aren\'t you glad Tom gave us enough money to buy something to eat?
Everybody makes mistakes. That\'s why they put erasers on pencils.
I don\'t believe a word of what people have been saying about her.
Tom finally mustered up the courage to say what needed to be said.
Tom had put off telling Mary the bad news for as long as possible.
Tom has a good reason for not telling Mary what she wants to know.
Tom has been a probation officer in Boston for more than 30 years.
Tom bought a pair of cheap shoes, but they didn\'t last very long.
We all chipped in thirty dollars to help pay for Tom\'s operation.
I couldn\'t meet him at the station because my car ran out of gas.
I didn\'t have any trouble convincing Tom to go to Boston with me.
Tom can\'t buy anything today, because he left his wallet at home.
There were twice as many university applicants in 1992 as in 1982.
Tom believed that the people in that small village were cannibals.
Tom could hear everything the people in the next room were saying.
Tom is going to lose his job if he keeps showing up late for work.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom doesn\'t want to go to Boston with Mary.
